ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course built on and expanded our vocabulary and grammar from CHNS110. We completed the Level One Part Two of the Integrated Chinese textbook sequence. With this vocabulary, we can talk about the weather, sports, birthdays, dating, directions, flights, and restaurants.
I learned a lot of Chinese and new skills.
Improved rudimentary knowledge of Chinese language speaking, listening, reading, and writing.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Chinese is taught extremely well at Yale. Professor Shen was so amazing; she covered so much content and was able to keep up our momentum throughout the entire semester.
The strengths was that it was really reinforcing; however, the weakness was that the lessons were taught too quick.

strengths --> very fun class, learned a lot
weaknesses --> a lot of content you need to learn on your own, fast paced class

Strengths- Constant practice, daily homeworks for reinforcement, extremely skilled and engaging professor. 
Weakness- Lack of collaborative classroom atmosphere.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! Learning Chinese was not as scary as I thought it would be, and there is so much love and support in the Yale Chinese Department.
I would recommend because the class is really helpful and will help my future in the long run.
yes if you are taking chinese for credit. it is a lot of content but the professors are very understanding and try to be helpful if you reach out to them

Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course. Don't let the workload rating intimidate you. Any entry-level language is going to be a lot of work. The daily homeworks aren't there to overwhelm you- they're there to reinforce what you're learning, and they're honestly very effective at doing that. Professor Shen is an AMAZING educator.
